AI based measurement/segmentation tool

×
As part of an internship I did, I worked on implementing and training several different artificial intelligence models, using Keras and Tensorflow. One such project I worked on involved developing a model for semantic image segmentation in order to segment credit cards and ID cards out of an image. The purpose of this was to measure objects in a static image(not using AR) by using a commonly found reference object that had the same dimensions universally. I found that almost all credit/ID cards follow the ID-1 convention meaning they have fixed dimensions, this allowed me to develop a tool that first segments the card out of an image, then finds the pixels to centimeters ratio and then uses that to find the dimensions of another object in an image, in this case a wound that had already been segmented using another model I trained for that. I am currently in the process of working on an app where users can use this to measure any object by simply taking a picture and then selecting the object they wish to measure.


A series of reddit and discord bots



×
I've worked on a series of bots for the reddit website, such as a bot to help out moderators by creating a simulated mod queue inside of Discord to better assist moderation, as well as a system for logging transactions for a trading based subreddit.


Easy IR | Hackathon Project



×
Easy IR is a project I worked on for my first hackathon, it's an circuit utilizing an arduino, accompanying a front-end website, the project allows a user to "record" an IR signal, for example a fan or TV remote and then replay it using the programming environment we developed. This would allow someone too, for example record their "lights-on" signal and then set our program to replay that signal at a certain time or a certain amount of times. The program's API is also easily added on and IFTTT/Webhook integration is planned.


Extraordinary Tech | Tech Review Website



×
I am currently working on developing a technology based review site you can find it here.


Email Tracking Extension



×
A simple email tracking extension, using JavaScript to create a front-end chrome-extension with a Python Flask backend. The extension notifies you when an email you sent has been opened. It does this by embedding a tiny image file in emails, with a programmatically generated URL leading to a server backend, when the link is triggered, the email has been opened.


Othello Game in Python



×
Othello is a strategy game played on a 8x8 board using tiles, where the goal is to control the entire board with a particular color's tiles, I built a version of Othello in Python, complete with, Player VS Player as well as a "computer" player, which a player can play against.


Old Memes Website



×
I recently started working on a "meme" website, using flask, webscraping and the API of a couple sites to serve an aggregate of "old memes" on OldMemes.com. It is still under development with more features being added.
